title: Fivestar4everMVP
author: Fivestar4everMVP
content: Hi gamblers, it's a simple question I want to ask...Remember it is said that, in gambling, the house always wins, I Want us to look at this two scenarios and tell if this are not actually a way to win/beat the house.. Imagine yourself as a new gambler who just joined a casino, played a few dollars and with luck on your side, you win money running into thousands of dollars, will withdrawing your money plus winnings from that casino, never to return there to play again, mean you have beaten that casino?Secondly, imagine that on your first day of gambling, you gambled $200 and in the process, won money running into hundreds of thousands of dollars, you withdraw the money and start up your own business, and never returned to gambling again, isn't this one way to beat the house?

comments.author: Lanatsa
comments.body: Dont make yourself to have this kind of believe that you do able to beat up the casino just because you did make some profits on the time that you do gamble because this is how the basic concept on how gamblingdo works and on what are the things that it could possibly give on which you cant really be able to make out conclusions that you had beaten up the house, Well on some sort then it do looks that day but on the same time isnt really something you should bother yourself because what matter the most is that you do able to quit out right away on the time that you are profiting because most of the timeon which people or gamblers do really failed up into this area.

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: Yes that's a strategy to beat casino but with extreme low probability that is not paid with high enough reward (poor risk/reward ratio) so its not the strategy that can be used for anyone because on average 60 out of 100 will not even double before loosing everything. So its not like every person who starts wins and only those who stays long enough in casino are losing. Some lose everything without being in a profit even a penny. It's a myth that new gamblers (first time in a casino) are luckier than others.Casino is a place to have fun and feel extreme emotions. Not a place to easily win first million.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: You may have beaten the house yourself, but people will still lose to it so in a way, they cannot be 100% beaten. As long as there are people playing in the casino, they will always operate, and they will surely make money off of people that way. If a lot of gamblers that win have this kind of self-control that, in the event that they win big they never played into any casino again, then the house may be beaten and they might close their doors for good. But again, most of these are theoretical, but a good one at that.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Actually, that's a good decision to make A big IF luck is on your side like winning the said amount and withdraw the winnings along with the money you deposited but no matter what you do casino can make a recovery from other gamblers so it's a win-win situation from casino and yourself but never for other gamblers. In other words, the house is not that easy to beat and I don't think someone can beat the house when it comes to gambling and most gamblers always lose.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMImagine yourself as a new gambler who just joined a casino, played a few dollars and with luck on your side, you win money running into thousands of dollars, will withdrawing your money plus winnings from that casino, never to return there to play again, mean you have beaten that casino?It's very possible but unlikely common thing gambkers do because they gamble to make fun and take advantage of winning along, they may not play with hige amount but there's more chances that many gambkers will continue, but it's also possible if it's a newbie who has never gambles before and took the risk out of no passion to bet a d win, definitely he may never return gambling and there's nothing that can be done to that.Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMSecondly, imagine that on your first day of gambling, you gambled $200 and in the process, won money running into hundreds of thousands of dollars, you withdraw the money and start up your own business, and never returned to gambling again, isn't this one way to beat the house?Either of the way is possible and can happen, but just as I've said earlier, those than can do such are not the regular gamblers, they are people that just cease an opportunity to give a try and got the luck they have always wanted through gambling, so i don't expect them to continue except if they want to return the whole money back into gambling with time which they may never have another opportunity for a second chance to win big.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: Although the house always has the advantage in gambling, It does not play an important role. And I do believe that there are people who continually make money from gambling. If you win a large sum in a casino on your first visit and never return, the first scenario you stated, may be seen as a win. You were fortunate to have time to withdraw your winnings before the odds caught up with you.In the second case, it would be wise to use the money you received to launch your own company. If you're able to utilize your gains to improve yourself and your future, then I'd say you've "fought" the house in that sense. Gambling may be addicting, I'd suggest to learn how to stop

comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMHi gamblers, it's a simple question I want to ask...Remember it is said that, in gambling, the house always wins, I Want us to look at this two scenarios and tell if this are not actually a way to win/beat the house.. The house is watching you after cooking up a way to beat the house  Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMImagine yourself as a new gambler who just joined a casino, played a few dollars and with luck on your side, you win money running into thousands of dollars, will withdrawing your money plus winnings from that casino, never to return there to play again, mean you have beaten that casino?If the first time gambler isn't going to be coming back, then technically this is one way to beat the house! But the problem is the house never forgets, and will be patiently waiting to win against you just to even out the odds. And honestly, anybody that has tasted success is always going to comeback for more and gamblers end up fulfilling the prophecy.... Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMSecondly, imagine that on your first day of gambling, you gambled $200 and in the process, won money running into hundreds of thousands of dollars, you withdraw the money and start up your own business, and never returned to gambling again, isn't this one way to beat the house?This one is certainly going to be classified as beating the house and probably only a handful of people fall into this category.

comments.author: Issa56
comments.body: The fact is that if you win in a casino, you will definitely want to go back, you can't just gamble once and you will win and you will just quit, if you win in your first gambling, you will think you are a lucky gambler and you will believe if you keep on playing, you will keep on winning, and in the process of playing you will start losing money gradually. The house is always winning, if you are a gambler, if you are having record of your profits and lose, then you will know that your lose is definitely higher than your win that's why they always say the house is always winning. If will be difficult for you to win huge amounts of money in your first gambling and you will quit.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMImagine yourself as a new gambler who just joined a casino, played a few dollars and with luck on your side, you win money running into thousands of dollars, will withdrawing your money plus winnings from that casino, never to return there to play again, mean you have beaten that casino?The casino can't be beaten. It means you retreated in time of not being beaten by the casino.Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMSecondly, imagine that on your first day of gambling, you gambled $200 and in the process, won money running into hundreds of thousands of dollars, you withdraw the money and start up your own business, and never returned to gambling again, isn't this one way to beat the house?I believe it's the same above situation. You retreated in time and made good us of the money won. It's even possible to keep coming back to the casino to gamble, using the profit from your business (which you own due to the winnings made from the casino), without being beaten by the house, although you are never able to beat them too!

comments.author: DoublerHunter
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PM~snip~Secondly, imagine that on your first day of gambling, you gambled $200 and in the process, won money running into hundreds of thousands of dollars, you withdraw the money and start up your own business, and never returned to gambling again, isn't this one way to beat the house?^This is not a gambler mindset.A gambler will always return to gamble even if they win or lose. But if you are going to ask my side if I were in that situation, of course, I will return and gamble but only those limited amount so that I know how to control my limit and probably the house cannot get back what I have won or it could be a long term but at least I am enjoyed. That is why gamblers act, they never mind what they lose but if they will win they are very happy considering that they lose a lot more than they won. So if you are running away form that gambling casino, can you promise yourself to never gamble again? I don't know if there is a gambler like that.

For me, if you have been able to win or on a positive gain on a casino, that could also mean that you've beaten the casino.Also, for the first scenario that you've mentioned, this was one of my methods before where I would try out and create accounts on different casino then will play a few games and leave once I've won a certain amount and never come back. It feels like I have beginners luck on those platforms.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: in the scenario you gave and as an individual, yeah, sure, you've beaten the casino, but at end of the day, the casino would still be in profit. also, I am pretty sure a lot of people have done this kind of "strategy" and the majority, if not all of them, are actually just a one-time gambler that got lucky.

Because whatever strategy you will apply, at the end of the day, house always win. But if you are a player who knows when to stop, you can go home as winner also.And what the OP presented is for me, one way to beat the house. You stop once you got your winnings.And use your winnings to improve your living. But remember, more gamblers will continue to play up until they lose it all, hence, why house always wins.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: The House always wins means that whether or not a bet is won a lose the house has a calibrated system that takes off a few percentages on each bet placed by all gamblers so in the end it is a win-win for the casino, but walking away when a gambler wins a good amount can save you a whole lot but them the tendency and zeal beat the house frequently will still lead to losing everything back to the house. -when a player wins and withdraws their winning the casino revenue only reduces since they will repay the winnings from the previous losses of others but even in doing that, the casino still charges a lot from the balance even though some of those charges are hidden from the gamblers.

comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on January 28, 2023, 07:23:59 PMHi gamblers, it's a simple question I want to ask...Remember it is said that, in gambling, the house always wins, I Want us to look at this two scenarios and tell if this are not actually a way to win/beat the house.. Smart people would stop once they get a big win and invest that money in something profitable since we all know that if you continue playing the casino will take all that money back if not more.I can give you a small example of Don Johnson with a quick search on google you can get many similar gamblers with insane profits which we can say they beaten the casino, But in the other hand it’s the casino is earning much more than they lose from the small amount of people who could gain from gambling so it doesn’t really matter for the casino but the opposite way that may bring more gamblers when they hear someone could earn much money with that casino and would like to try their chances there. 1 person beat the house but 100 or more people lose against the house.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Most gamblers cannot show the kind of control it takes to never gamble again once they have won a large sum of money. They will get it in their brain that they can do it again and not realize that they might have been extremely lucky the 1st time around. Kudos to you if you can exhibit that kind of control, but 99.9% will not be able to.

comments.author: Johnyz
comments.body: This might only work if you are lucky enough to win the money on every casino that you are going to play with because you can run from your first casino but there’s no guarantee that you will win on your second casino so there’s still a risk and of course no guaranteed return in gambling. If you will gamble with your first attempt only and will never try it again, this could be possible.
